body_html:
Hey Maud, you can resolve the merge conflicts when you expand the "command line instructions" (only step 1 though) in the greyed-out merge area below; it should be displayed for you as well since you're a member of the org.

When you do the git pull in step no. 1 you should get the merge conflict (in routes.rb). You can resolve it with git mergetool. When you've resolved the mc, commit what's already been staged push it to your remote branch again. This should update the PR.
body_text:
Hey Maud, you can resolve the merge conflicts when you expand the "command line instructions"  (only step 1 though) in the greyed-out merge area below; it should be displayed for you as well since you're a member of the org.
When you do the git pull in step no. 1 you should get the merge conflict (in routes.rb). You can resolve it with git mergetool. When you've resolved the mc, commit what's already been staged push it to your remote branch again. This should update the PR.
body:
Hey Maud, you can resolve the merge conflicts when you expand the "command line instructions"  (only step 1 though) in the greyed-out merge area below; it should be displayed for you as well since you're a member of the org.

When you do the git pull in step no. 1 you should get the merge conflict (in `routes.rb`). You can resolve it with `git mergetool`. When you've resolved the mc, commit what's already been staged push it to your remote branch again. This should update the PR.
